Class MainCockpitComp

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Model.Tiles.Component
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Model.Tiles.HousingUnit
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Model.Tiles.MainCockpitComp
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class MainCockpitComp extends HousingUnit
The MainCockpitComp class represents the main cockpit component of a housing unit. It is responsible for managing human crew members, ensuring connections to other components, and enforcing specific rules about the presence of aliens or addons. This class extends the HousingUnit base class, inheriting its core functionality, while also implementing additional features specific to the main cockpit.
See Also:

    • accept

      public void accept(ComponentAction visitor, PlayerState State)
      Accepts a visitor implementing a specific action on the component and player state. This method enables the use of the visitor pattern, allowing interaction between the current component and a specified action. The visitor performs its logic on the component based on the provided player state.
      Specified by:
      accept in class HousingUnit
      Parameters:
      visitor - the ComponentAction visitor that defines the action to be performed
      State - the current state of the player, which may influence the action's logic

    • kill

      public int kill()
      Decreases the number of humans present in the MainCockPitComp. If the count of humans reaches zero, the component is removed from connected housing units in the player board and notifies nearby housing units. Finally, it sends updates to the associated tile.
      Specified by:
      kill in class HousingUnit
      Returns:
      an integer value of 2 to indicate the completion of the operation.
      Throws:
      InvalidInput - if there are no humans present in the MainCockPitComp.

    • addCrew

      public void addCrew(int humans, boolean purple, boolean brown)
      Adds crew members to the main cockpit, ensuring that the specified number of humans and alien types adhere to the prescribed constraints. Notifies nearby housing units and sends updates regarding the crew addition.
      Specified by:
      addCrew in class HousingUnit
      Parameters:
      humans - the number of human crew members to add
      purple - specifies if a purple alien is being added
      brown - specifies if a brown alien is being added
      Throws:
      InvalidInput - if attempts are made to add aliens (purple or brown) or if the total number of humans exceeds the allowed limit of 2

      public void setConnected(boolean connected)
      Sets the connection state of the component.
      Parameters:
      connected - the new connection state to set; true if the component is connected, false otherwise
